newsitem.title: USA: Hewlett-Packard to cut computer prices - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Hewlett-Packard to cut computer prices - NYT.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co. plans to cut prices on commercial desktop computers by as much as 24 percent, beginning next week, The New York Times said.
In Thursday's edition, the paper said the company is hoping to pre-empt a price-cutting announcement scheduled for Thursday by Compaq Computer.
The moves by Compaq and Hewlett-Packard are expected to be followed by similar cuts by IBM, the article said.
The three companies are trying to match lower prices offered by Dell Computer, which has been growing at a faster rate, the article said.
A Hewlett-Packard spokesman is quoted in the article as saying the cuts will not compromise the company's profitability.
